name: standouts_title_genres_plot
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title, genres, plot
Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
You should consider the given title, genres, plot for every movie.

Identify movies that stand out from the rest in the given information, as they may impact the perceived diversity of the list.
List of movies with similar features may feel more diverse if it includes one or more outliers.  

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A with the focus on outliers.
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B with the focus on outliers.
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C with the focus on outliers.
    "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
    "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
    "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
}

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
GENRES: Action, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

TITLE: Snatch (2000)
GENRES: Comedy, Crime
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
GENRES: Action, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.

TITLE: Jurassic Park (1993)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Thriller
PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Comedy, Sci-Fi
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Others, The (2001)
GENRES: Horror, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

TITLE: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
GENRES: Biography, Drama
PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

TITLE: The Hunger Games (2012)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Thriller
PLOT: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.


List B:

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety. It has the action thrillers of the Bourne series and The Hunger Games, the sci-fi adventure of Jurassic Park and Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2, and then outliers in the form of a comedy-crime film (Snatch), a horror-mystery (The Others), and a biographical drama (A Beautiful Mind).  The inclusion of these outliers prevents the list from feeling too homogenous.
response.list_B_description: List B is fairly diverse, but less so than List A.  It features a mix of genres including sci-fi (Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2, Avengers), comedy (School of Rock, Moonrise Kingdom), drama (Rain Man, Catch Me If You Can, Inglourious Basterds), horror (The Others), and a war film (Inglourious Basterds). However, it lacks the strong thematic grouping seen in List A's action thrillers. The outliers here are less impactful in terms of diversity.
response.list_C_description: List C has a similar structure to List A, with a core of action thrillers (Bourne Identity, Bourne Supremacy) and sci-fi (Edge of Tomorrow, War of the Worlds).  The outliers are Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2, The Others, Moonrise Kingdom, and Rain Man.  The outliers are effective in breaking up the action/sci-fi theme, but the list feels slightly less diverse than List A due to the repetition of similar plots within the action/sci-fi sub-group.
response.comparison: List A and List C are quite similar in their diversity, both using outliers to break up genre clusters. List B is less diverse because its outliers are less effective at diversifying the list. List A has a slightly stronger mix of genres and outlier impact, making it marginally more diverse than List C.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A stands out due to its effective use of outliers. The inclusion of Snatch, The Others, and A Beautiful Mind creates a more noticeable contrast to the action and sci-fi elements, resulting in a more varied and engaging list.  While List C is also diverse, List A's outliers are more distinct and impactful.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and styles.  The inclusion of animation (Up, Finding Dory), a biographical crime drama (Spotlight), and a science fiction thriller (Ex Machina) provides contrast to the more conventional war drama (Saving Private Ryan) and crime dramas (Fight Club, Goodfellas).  Up stands out as a family-friendly animated film, contrasting sharply with the darker themes of the other movies.
response.list_B_description: List B has a similar structure to List A, with a mix of genres. However, it leans more towards action and adventure films.  The inclusion of Monsters, Inc. offers a family-friendly animated option, while Sherlock Holmes adds a classic mystery element.  Mr. & Mrs. Smith acts as an outlier with its comedic action elements, contrasting with the more serious tones of the other films.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a diverse selection of films, but with a noticeable concentration on action and thriller genres.  The inclusion of Hacksaw Ridge (a war film with a unique perspective) and Hell or High Water (a Western crime drama) provides some contrast.  Avengers: Infinity War stands out as a major blockbuster superhero film, differing significantly from the other films in terms of scale and scope.  Maze Runner adds a science fiction element.
response.comparison: All three lists exhibit some diversity in genre and style, but List A offers the most balanced mix. List B leans towards action and adventure, while List C has a stronger emphasis on action and thrillers.  List A's inclusion of animation, a biographical crime drama, and a science fiction thriller provides a more significant contrast to the other films.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A stands out due to its broader representation of genres and styles. The inclusion of animation (Up, Finding Dory), a biographical crime drama (Spotlight), and a science fiction thriller (Ex Machina) creates a more varied and engaging collection compared to the other lists.  These outliers effectively balance the more conventional genres present in the list, resulting in a more diverse and interesting selection of films.

The inclusion of Intouchables (a biographical comedy-drama) and Knives Out (a comedic mystery-thriller) offer some diversity, but the list still feels somewhat homogenous.  WALLÂ·E, with its animated family-friendly style, stands out as a significant outlier.
response.comparison: List A exhibits the most diverse range of genres and film styles, with a good balance between different types of movies. List B has a decent mix but is weighted towards dramas. List C shows less diversity, with a concentration on action, adventure, and Sci-Fi films.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A stands out due to its inclusion of a wider variety of genres and tones.  The presence of outliers like Inside Out (animation), The Matrix (Sci-Fi), and Requiem for a Dream (dark drama) significantly enhances its diversity compared to the other lists.
